channel.title: Item model in wrong position
channel.description:
Oh and I have already posted this in client help and I thought it could as well go in server help.
So I want to add the Dragon Platebody and I add the model like usual. I run the server and client, log in and wear the Platebody. But it is in the wrong position. Here is a preview and code I put below. Picture [img]http://img339.imageshack.us/img339/1991/evolved0028.png[/img] Ints:[code]if(i == 15641) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield";//New option class8.anIntArray156 = new int[2]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int[2]; class8.anIntArray156[0] = 43072; class8.anIntArray160[0] = 925; class8.anIntArray156[1] = 4550; class8.anIntArray160[1] = 925; class8.anInt174 = 14104; //Model ID class8.anInt181 = 1330; //zoom increase will make it smaller class8.anInt190 = 310; //model rotate up+down increase to move doen away from you class8.anInt198 = 1800; //model rotate side ways increase to move right in circle class8.anInt169 = 0; // model offset increase to move to the right class8.anInt194 = 1; //model offset increase to move up class8.anInt165 = 14105;//male wearing class8.anInt200 = 14105;//female wearing class8.anInt164 = -1;//Female arms/sleeves class8.anInt188 = -1;//male arms/sleeves class8.aBoolean176 = false;//Stackable class8.aString170 = "Dragon platebody";//Name of the new item class8.aByteArray178 = "Provides excellent protection".getBytes();//examin info }[/code] Item.java: [code]public static int platebody[] = { 14523, 14527, 14531, 14503, 14507, 14538, 14540, 14542, 14544, 14546, 14548, 14550, 14553, 14554, 14555, 14556, 14557, 14531, 14512, 15348, 5032, 5028, 6065, 1844, 5034, 6750, 6617, 5575, 7399, 6322, 6139, 6133, 6129, 7390, 7392, 6916, 1035, 540, 5553, 4757, 1833, 1835, 6388, 6384, 1355, 4111, 4101, 4091, 6186, 6184, 6180, 3058, 4509, 4504, 4069, 4728, 4736, 4712, 6107, 2661, 3140, 1115, 1117, 1119, 1121, 1123, 1125, 1127, 2583, 2591, 2599, 2607, 2615, 2623, 2653, 2669, 3481, 4720, 4728, 4749, 2661, 426, 3387, 7695, 544, 7689, 7660, 7670, 7661, 7669, 7698, 7642, 546, 15641, 14104, 14105 };[/code] (I thought putting up ints is useful) Then I followed this tutorial where in your source folder, you open up item.java. So I opened it and searched for body. I typed in the body section, the item id (15641) Is that the correct number to put up in item.java? Please tell me if I have done something wrong

item.title: Item model in wrong position
item.dc:creator: @fil55 fil55
item.description:
@fil55 wrote:

[quote=“pot up pls, post:6, topic:398058”]This is like the simplest thing to do on a rsps, other than changing names.[/quote]I know. Its just that it wont work.

Read full topic

item.title: Item model in wrong position
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“frenkerscape, post:4, topic:398058”][quote author=fil55 link=topic=495189.msg3620413#msg3620413 date=1307355383]
I added 15641 into the body section in item.java and added the stats and all that in item.cfg. Compiled and runned but still don’t work
Oh and btw, what is PI? I’m quite a noob at this as you can see lol.
[/quote]PI means “project insanity” its a base of a server but i think that your base delta is[/quote]
if you ever worked with PI then you would tell by the class8.java that this is definitely not PI… this is delta base

Read full topic

item.description:
@ipwnunoobs wrote:

item.cfg bro. if you are you using PI.

In item.java add the ID of the object you spawn.

item.description:
@fil55 wrote:

Oh and I have already posted this in client help and I thought it could as well go in server help.

So I want to add the Dragon Platebody and I add the model like usual. I run the server and client, log in and wear the Platebody. But it is in the wrong position. Here is a preview and code I put below.

Ints:if(i == 15641) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield";//New option class8.anIntArray156 = new int[2]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int[2]; class8.anIntArray156[0] = 43072; class8.anIntArray160[0] = 925; class8.anIntArray156[1] = 4550; class8.anIntArray160[1] = 925; class8.anInt174 = 14104; //Model ID class8.anInt181 = 1330; //zoom increase will make it smaller class8.anInt190 = 310; //model rotate up+down increase to move doen away from you class8.anInt198 = 1800; //model rotate side ways increase to move right in circle class8.anInt169 = 0; // model offset increase to move to the right class8.anInt194 = 1; //model offset increase to move up class8.anInt165 = 14105;//male wearing class8.anInt200 = 14105;//female wearing class8.anInt164 = -1;//Female arms/sleeves class8.anInt188 = -1;//male arms/sleeves class8.aBoolean176 = false;//Stackable class8.aString170 = "Dragon platebody";//Name of the new item class8.aByteArray178 = "Provides excellent protection".getBytes();//examin info }
Item.java: public static int platebody[] = { 14523, 14527, 14531, 14503, 14507, 14538, 14540, 14542, 14544, 14546, 14548, 14550, 14553, 14554, 14555, 14556, 14557, 14531, 14512, 15348, 5032, 5028, 6065, 1844, 5034, 6750, 6617, 5575, 7399, 6322, 6139, 6133, 6129, 7390, 7392, 6916, 1035, 540, 5553, 4757, 1833, 1835, 6388, 6384, 1355, 4111, 4101, 4091, 6186, 6184, 6180, 3058, 4509, 4504, 4069, 4728, 4736, 4712, 6107, 2661, 3140, 1115, 1117, 1119, 1121, 1123, 1125, 1127, 2583, 2591, 2599, 2607, 2615, 2623, 2653, 2669, 3481, 4720, 4728, 4749, 2661, 426, 3387, 7695, 544, 7689, 7660, 7670, 7661, 7669, 7698, 7642, 546, 15641, 14104, 14105 };
(I thought putting up ints is useful)
Then I followed this tutorial where in your source folder, you open up item.java. So I opened it and searched for body. I typed in the body section, the item id (15641) Is that the correct number to put up in item.java? Please tell me if I have done something wrong
